title: Australia Needs to Boost Private Credit Standards, Says Watchdog - Bloomberg
summary:
Australia’s private credit sector must improve standards around valuations, governance and liquidity to align with global practices and boost investor confidence, an industry watchdog said.
The Australian Securities & Investments Commission flagged widespread issues across the fast-growing A$200 billion ($132 billion) asset class in an interim report published Monday.
Key concerns include opaque remuneration and fee structures, inconsistent valuation practices and unclear definition of key terms, among others, according to the report.

title: Australia Recognizes Palestinian State, Private Credit: Australia Briefing - Bloomberg
summary:
Good morning and welcome back, it’s Ainsley here with all the news you need to kick off your working week.
Today’s must-reads: • Australia recognizes Palestinian state • ASIC calls for better private credit standards • Optus CEO pledges to make changes Australia joined the UK and Canada toformally recognize a Palestinian state, joining a growing global consensus and pushing ahead with a policy that has drawn criticism from US President Donald Trump.
Further steps by Australia, “including the establishment of diplomatic relations and opening of embassies, will be considered as the Palestinian Authority makes progress on its commitments to reform,” Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Foreign Minister Penny Wong said in a joint statement.
